javelin.model.condition

Class Condition

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.condition.Condition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Barkskin, Blinking, Breathless, Charging, Cunning, Darkvision, Defending, DefensiveStance, Dominated, Enduring, Fatigued, Feigned, FindingTraps, Flying, Graceful, Grappling, Heroic, Knowledgeable, Neutralized, Paralyzed, Poisoned, Prone, Resistant, Shaken, Splendid, Strider, Strong, Stunned, Vampiric, Wise

    public abstract class Condition
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    A condition is a temporary effect on a Combatant.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Combatant.conditions, Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Condition.Effect
      Buff means an effect is benefitial while debuff means it's a penalty.

      AP at which this effect will wear off.

    • Field Detail

      • expireat

        public float expireat
        AP at which this effect will wear off. Use Float.MAX_VALUE to make it permanent for the duration of battle.

      • effect

        public final Condition.Effect effect
        See Also:
        Condition.Effect

      • description

        public final java.lang.String description
        Short description.

      • longterm

        public java.lang.Integer longterm
        The number of hours for this to persist after battle. If null will call end(Combatant) at the end of combat. If 0 will stop at the end of combat but affect the original Combatant the one used in-battle was cloned from.

      • stacks

        public boolean stacks
        If false will extend expireat of pre-existing condition instead of adding and applying a new instance.

      • casterlevel

        public java.lang.Integer casterlevel
        null if this is not magical and can't be affected by DispelMagic.

      • dispel

        public void dispel()
        This is called when a condition is removed by DispelMagic, mostly as a way to prevent negative effects from happening in end(Combatant), when applicable. See Poisoned as an example.
